generated.title: GeneratedBetaDisintegrationEnergy
generated.description: This is an autogenerated partial class definition of 'BetaDisintegrationEnergy'

description*.en: "Beta Disintegration Energy" is the  energy released by a beta particle radioactive decay. It is the sum of the maximum beta-particle kinetic energy and the recoil energy of the atom produced in the reference frame in which the emitting nucleus is at rest before its disintegration.

title: BetaDisintegrationEnergy
description: "Beta Disintegration Energy" is the  energy released by a beta particle radioactive decay. It is the sum of the maximum beta-particle kinetic energy and the recoil energy of the atom produced in the reference frame in which the emitting nucleus is at rest before its disintegration.
